New Records: First time in Dodgers' history the team hit three consecutive home runs to lead off a game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman hit consecutive home runs to lead off the game.
Corbin Carroll hit an inside-the-park home run for the Diamondbacks.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. hit a two-run double and a home run.
Max Muncy hit an RBI single.
Tommy Edman hit a two-run single in the ninth inning.
Evan Phillips retired the side in order in the ninth inning to secure the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Miguel Rojas emphasized the importance of winning tight games as preparation for the playoffs.
Evan Phillips reflected on handling emotions and the importance of fighting adversity.
Dave Roberts highlighted the team's competitive spirit and the need to maintain intensity.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dodgers had only three available relievers and used all four position players on the bench.
Gavin Stone pitched five innings and 84 pitches.
Ben Casparius earned the victory in his MLB debut.
